beer.beer_description: One of the only American Hefeweizens made using the traditional Bavarian style of open fermentation. This difficult and labor-intensive technique adds uncommon depth and flavor complexity. A deeply flavorful hazy-golden hefeweizen, it is refreshing and perfect for a sunny day.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 120 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 25!

This difficult and labor-intensive technique adds uncommon depth and flavor complexity. A deeply flavorful hazy-golden hefeweizen, it is refreshing and perfect for a sunny day.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 69)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 70!

If your mash uses more than 50% wheat, you’ve got yourself a wheat beer. This diverse family includes goses, hefeweizens, American wheat ales, and more! That's 110 different beers in the "Wheat" category! Try 5 more for Level 23!

items.checkin_comment: Decent. Has a more Belgian aftertaste than German wheat.

user.bio: My HopHead Bride, Spider-man, Chicago Cubs, Good Beer

items.badge_description: One cannot live on dank hops alone. Tone down the bitterness and enjoy some smooth flavor. That's 465 different beers with an IBU of 20 or below.  Try 5 more for Level 94!

That's 290 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 59! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

user.bio: Old and decrepit but continuing a life time's interest in beer.
From Yakima, my first beer was Grant's Scottish Ale
Please find enclosed a copy of my CV and a printout of my Untappd checkins

items.checkin_comment: Banana sweetness and clove spice but balanced by that slight bit of funk

user.bio: Chemist & ex brewing professor. Providing a balance to the force in the form of trying beer & saying what I think.
